remarks.para: Tooltips are the messages that appear next to a widget when the mouse pointer is held over it for a short amount of time. They are especially helpful for adding more verbose descriptions of things such as in a toolbar.
An individual tooltip belongs to a group of tooltips. A group is created by calling the constructor . Every tooltip in the group can then be turned off with and on with .
To assign a tip to a particular , is used.
Note: Tooltips can only be set on widgets which have their own X window. To add a tooltip to a that does not have its own , place the widget inside a and add a tooltip to that instead.
The default appearance of all tooltips in a program is determined by the current Gtk theme that the user has selected.
